newsitem.title: GREECE: Bank/Greece intervenes, sells 200mln ecus at fix.
newsitem.headline: Bank/Greece intervenes, sells 200mln ecus at fix.

text.p: The Bank of Greece intervened at the fixing for a second consecutive day and sold 200 million ecus and 25 million marks to shore up the drachma, dealers said.

"The central bank sold 200 million ecus and 25 million marks to prop up the drachma," a forex dealer at a foreign bank said. "It's clear to me that the central bank does not wish to see the ecu/drachma rate settling above 312 at the fixing."
The Bank of Greece sold 350 million ecus and 80 million marks for drachmas at the fixing on Tuesday.
Ecu/drachma settled at 311.95 at the fixing on Wednesday, marginally higher than Tuesday's 311.900 and the mark/drachma cross was set at 160.135 from 160.100 on Tuesday.
The drachma opened at 312 versus the ecu and retreated on early ecu buying from abroad but pared some of its losses to trade in the 312.00/40 corridor prior to the fixing, dealers said.
